intro: Callista daphnoides, commonly known as the silverleaf daphne, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its dense, silvery-gray foliage and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Thymelaeaceae and is often grown as an ornamental due to its aesthetic appeal. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. However, it is toxic to humans and animals, requiring caution in cultivation.
